speaker: Liam
text: Hey, do you think we could create a mobile app that recommends coding tutorials based on someone's skill level?
ipa: heɪ | dʊ jə θɪŋk wi kʊd kriˈeɪt ə ˈmoʊbəl æp ðæt ˌrɛkəˈmɛndz ˈkoʊdɪŋ tʊˈtɔriəlz beɪst ɑn ˈsʌmwʌnz skɪl ˈlɛvəl
stress: HEY | do YOU THINK we COULD CREATE a MOBILE APP that RECOMMENDS CODING TUTORIALS based on SOMEONE'S SKILL LEVEL
linking:
"do you" → /dʊ jə/ (linking 'do' to 'you')
"could create" → /kʊd kriˈeɪt/ (linking 'could' to 'create')
"based on" → /beɪst ɑn/ (linking 'based' to 'on')

speaker: Sophia
text: Yeah, that could work! We might need a solid algorithm, though. Have you heard of any tools we can use to build recommendation systems easily?
ipa: jæ | ðæt kʊd wɜrk | wi maɪt nid ə ˈsɑlɪd ˈælɡəˌrɪðəm ðoʊ | hæv jʊ hɜrd əv ˈɛni tulz wi kən juz tə bɪld ˌrɛkəˈmɛndeɪʃən ˈsɪstəmz ˈiːzəli
stress: YEAH | that COULD WORK | we MIGHT NEED a SOLID ALGORITHM, THOUGH | HAVE YOU HEARD of ANY TOOLS we can USE to BUILD RECOMMENDATION SYSTEMS EASILY
linking:
"have you" → /hæv jʊ/ (linking 'have' to 'you')
"can use" → /kən juz/ (linking 'can' to 'use')

speaker: Liam
text: Actually, TensorFlow can be an option. Or, if that's too complex, we are able to use some simpler APIs like RapidAPI.
ipa: ˈækʧuəli | ˈtɛnsɚfloʊ kən bi ən ˈɑpʃən | ɔr | ɪf ðæts tu kəmˈplɛks | wi ɑr ˈeɪbəl tə juz səm ˈsɪmplɚ ˌeɪpiˈaɪz laɪk ˌræpɪdˌeɪpiˈaɪ
stress: ACTUALLY | TENSORFLOW can be an OPTION | OR | if THAT'S TOO COMPLEX | we ARE ABLE to USE some SIMPLER APIs like RAPIDAPI
linking:
"can be" → /kən bi/ (linking 'can' to 'be')
"are able" → /ɑr ˈeɪbəl/ (linking 'are' to 'able')

speaker: Sophia
text: Good point. Also, we may want to think about scalability. If a lot of users join, we might have to upgrade our server pretty quickly.
ipa: ɡʊd pɔɪnt | ˈɔlsoʊ | wi meɪ wɑnt tə θɪŋk əˈbaʊt ˌskeɪləˈbɪlɪti | ɪf ə lɑt əv ˈjuzɚz ʤɔɪn | wi maɪt hæv tə ˈʌpɡreɪd aʊɚ ˈsɜrvɚ ˈprɪti ˈkwɪkli
stress: GOOD POINT | ALSO | we MAY WANT to THINK about SCALABILITY | if a LOT of USERS JOIN | we MIGHT HAVE to UPGRADE our SERVER PRETTY QUICKLY
linking:
"may want to" → /meɪ wɑnt tə/ (linking 'may' to 'want to')
"have to" → /hæf tə/ (linking 'have' to 'to')

speaker: Liam
text: True. And in case TensorFlow feels like overkill, we could always switch to basic filtering methods at first.
ipa: tru | ənd ɪn keɪs ˈtɛnsɚfloʊ filz laɪk ˈoʊvɚˌkɪl | wi kʊd ˈɔlweɪz swɪʧ tə ˈbeɪsɪk ˈfɪltərɪŋ ˈmɛθədz ət fɜrst
stress: TRUE | and in CASE TENSORFLOW FEELS like OVERKILL | we COULD ALWAYS SWITCH to BASIC FILTERING METHODS at FIRST
linking:
"could always" → /kʊd ˈɔlweɪz/ (linking 'could' to 'always')
"switch to" → /swɪʧ tə/ (linking 'switch' to 'to')

speaker: Sophia
text: Exactly! It's good to remember that there are alternatives to heavy machine learning solutions.
ipa: ɪɡˈzæktli | ɪts ɡʊd tə rɪˈmɛmbɚ ðæt ðɛr ɑr ɔlˈtɜrnətɪvz tə ˈhɛvi məˈʃin ˈlɜrnɪŋ səˈluʃənz
stress: EXACTLY | it's GOOD to REMEMBER that there are ALTERNATIVES to HEAVY MACHINE LEARNING SOLUTIONS
linking:
"is able" → /ɪz ˈeɪbəl/ (linking 'is' to 'able')
"to do" → /tə du/ (linking 'to' to 'do')

speaker: Sophia
text: Sometimes a smart SQL query is able to do the trick!
ipa: ˈsʌmtaɪmz ə smɑrt ˌɛsˌkjuˈɛl ˈkwɛri ɪz ˈeɪbəl tə du ðə trɪk
stress: SOMETIMES a SMART SQL QUERY is ABLE to DO the TRICK
linking:
"is able" → /ɪz ˈeɪbəl/ (linking 'is' to 'able')
"to do" → /tə du/ (linking 'to' to 'do')

speaker: Liam
text: Haha, so true! And who knows — we might even get some investors if the app takes off.
ipa: hɑ hɑ | soʊ tru | ənd hu noʊz — wi maɪt ˈivən ɡɛt səm ɪnˈvɛstɚz ɪf ði æp teɪks ɔf
stress: HAHA | SO TRUE | and WHO KNOWS — we MIGHT EVEN GET some INVESTORS if the APP TAKES OFF
linking:
"might even" → /maɪt ˈivən/ (linking 'might' to 'even')
"takes off" → /teɪks ɔf/ (linking 'takes' to 'off')

speaker: Sophia
text: I like your optimism. Let's see if we can draft a basic plan tonight.
ipa: aɪ laɪk jʊɚ ˈɑptɪˌmɪzəm | lɛts si ɪf wi kən dræft ə ˈbeɪsɪk plæn təˈnaɪt
stress: I LIKE your OPTIMISM | LET'S SEE if we can DRAFT a BASIC PLAN TONIGHT
linking:
"let's see" → /lɛts si/ (linking 'let's' to 'see')
"draft a" → /dræft ə/ (linking 'draft' to 'a')
